docs.title: HTML Basics
docs.text: This documentation covers the fundamental structure of an HTML document and also includes some commonly used HTML tags.

docs.title: Structure
docs.text:
Here is the basic structure of an HTML document:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>My Website</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <p>Hello world!</p>
  </body>
</html>
  • <!DOCTYPE html> - Declares the document type and version of HTML.
  • <head></head> - Contains metadata (data about the document) that is not displayed on the webpage.
  • <body></body> - Contains the main content of the webpage that is displayed to users.

docs.title: HTML Tags
docs.text:
HTML is built using tags, which define the structure and content of the webpage. Most tags follow this format:

  • An opening tag: <tag_name>
  • A closing tag: </tag_name>
Example
<h1>My Website</h1>

Some tags are self-closing and do not require a closing tag. These are typically used for elements that do not have content.

Example
<input type="text">
<img src="image.jpg" alt="Example image">

Note

HTML files must have the .html file extension (e.g., index.html).

docs.title: Text Color
docs.text:
Example
<p style="color: red;">Hello world!</p>

docs.title: Background Color
docs.text:
Example
<p style="background: blue; color: red;">Hello world!</p>

docs.title: Font Family
docs.text:
<p style="font-family: Sans-serif;">Hello world!</p>
<p style="font-family: 'Courier New';">Hello world!</p>
<p style="font-family: monospace;">Hello world!</p>

docs.title: Font Size
docs.text:
<p style="font-size: 16px;">Hello world!</p>
<p style="font-size: 32px;">Hello world!</p>

Tip

  • px is short for pixel.
  • In most browsers, the default size for text is 16px.

docs.title: Font Weight
Paragraphs
docs.text:
<p>Hello world!</p>
<p>Hello user!</p>

docs.title: Headings
docs.text:
<h1>Heading 1</h1>
<h2>Heading 2</h2>
<h3>Heading 3</h3>
<h4>Heading 4</h4>
<h5>Heading 5</h5>
<h6>Heading 6</h6>

docs.title: Text Formatting
docs.text:
<b>Bold text</b><br>
<strong>Strong text</strong><br>
<i>Italic text</i><br>
<em>Emphasized text</em><br>
<mark>Marked text</mark><br>
<small>Smaller text</small><br>
<del>Deleted text</del><br>
<ins>Inserted text</ins><br>
Subscript text <sub>sub</sub><br>
Superscript text <sup>sup</sup>

docs.title: Break Line
docs.text:
Written as <br>

WithWithout 
<b>Bold text</b><br>
<strong>Strong text</strong><br>
<i>Italic text</i>


<b>Bold text</b>
<strong>Strong text</strong>
<i>Italic text</i>

docs.title: Image
docs.text: <img src="/assets/cat.png" alt="cat sitting on floor">

docs.title: Ordered Lists
docs.text:
<ol>
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ol>
<ol type="a">
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ol>
<ol type="A">
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ol>
<ol type="i">
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ol>
<ol type="I">
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ol>

docs.title: Unordered Lists
docs.text:
<ul type="disc"> <!-- (1)! -->
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ul>
<ul type="square">
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ul>
<ul type="circle">
  <li>Item 1</li>
  <li>Item 2</li>
</ul>
  1. type="disc" is the default type for unordered list.

docs.title: Description List
docs.text:
<dl>
  <dt>Item 1</dt>
  <dd>Description 1</dd>
  <dt>Item 2</dt>
  <dd>Description 2</dd>
  <dt>Item 3</dt>
  <dd>Description 3</dd>
</dl>

docs.title: Nested List
docs.text:
<ul>
  <li>
    Files
    <ol>
      <li>Open file</li>
      <li>Create file</li>
      <li>Rename file</li>
      <li>Delete file</li>
    </ol>
  </li>
  <li>
    Topics
    <ol type="a">
      <li>Cat</li>
      <li>Dog</li>
      <li>Rabbit</li>
      <li>Lizard</li>
    </ol>
  </li>
</ul>

docs.title: Font
docs.text:
<p>
  <font face="Sans-Serif">Hello world!</font>
</p>
<p>
  <font face="Serif">Hello world!</font>
</p>
<p>
  <font face="Monospace">Hello world!</font>
</p>

Tip

Visit this link to see the list of available fonts.

docs.title: Fieldset and Legend
docs.text:
<fieldset>
  <legend>Fieldset Example</legend>
  <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Nam, facere.</p>
</fieldset>

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text:
<input type="text" placeholder="Enter a text"><br>
<input type="email" placeholder="Enter your email"><br>
<input type="password" placeholder="Enter your password"><br>
<input type="radio"> Item 1<br>
<input type="radio"> Item 2<br>
<input type="radio"> Item 3<br>
<input type="checkbox"> Item 1<br>
<input type="checkbox"> Item 2<br>
<input type="checkbox"> Item 3<br>

docs.title: Select
